review_title: Lots of Heart, But Leadership Needs Work
pros: The faculty and staff are generally very kind people who care about the students. It's fun to work on a university campus - lots of energy, events going on, and the ability to walk outside to go to different buildings (not the case at every workplace!). There is an atmosphere of learning, so employees (depending on the department) are often encouraged to seek out training and best practices. Having two days off at spring break and two weeks at Christmas is nice.
cons: Cabinet members and Board of Trustees tended to follow the political whims of the president versus doing what was in the best interest of the students or the university as an institution of higher education. The effects from poor leadership decisions and the lack of critical thinking trickled down to the rest of faculty and staff, which hurt morale. Also, the pay is fairly low, and benefits are pretty basic. Ex. no maternity leave other than short-term disability.
